review_blob: Jet black pour with minimal head and lacing. The aromas include chocolate, roasted malt and black licorice. Initially the flavors show a nice, almost burnt roasted malt and milk chocolate. Nice creamy mouth feel, a little sticky and slick especially for a 5.3% ABV beer. Smooth, dry bitter finish. Top notch regular milk stout

Poured from growler filled at Rons bar and grill. Hazy brown color with small tan head and no lacing. Smells phenomenal with aromas of hazelnuts, roasted malt, caramel and subtle hits of chocolate. Taste follows the nose, but the mouth feel a bit watered down and thin in compared to the way it smells. Overall it is a very unique and tasty brown ale that smells like a much bigger beer

On tap at the Maui brewery brewpub. Jet black pour with a khaki head. Aromas of chocolate, roasted malts and frappuchino. Tastes follows the nose. Creamy, smooth mouth feel with medium carbonation. Overall a tasty milk stout. Best brew I had that night. Would definitely buy it again if I saw it.
beer_name: Maui Brewing Milk of Amnesia Stout

review_blob: Pours blackwith one finger of tan head. Very nice lacing as it goes down. Aromas of black coffee, rich dark chocolate, roast malt and hints of cream, and burnt toffee. Flavor follows the nose begining with rich and deep notes of roast malt, black coffee and bitter cocoa and toffee. Middle continues this flavor, adding bittersweet chocolate and light burnt caramel. Finish is roasty and bitter with notes of coffee with cream, black coffee and roast malt along with a light sweet caramel. Aftertaste is of burnt toast and roast malt. Mouthfeel thick, creamy and velvety smooth with moderate carbonation.This is a fantastic porter, well deserving of all the accolades

Dark brown pour with a minimal head. Aromas of chocolate and coffee. Tastes like a milk stout, but it is completely dairy-free; cocoa and espresso and roasted malts. As advertised it has a smooth, creamy texture. Not terribly impressed with this one.

Sweet baby Jesus on steroids. Pours dark brown with a small head, minimal lacying. Nose is chocolate and peanut butter. Taste follows the nose, but has a much more walnut, nutty flavor than SBJ. Creamy mouth feel with little carbonation.

Dark brown appearance with a small mocha head. Minimum lacing left as it dissipates. Aroma is a mix of chocolate syrup and Nutella. Taste is sweet, initially with a dry bitterness that follows. Flavors of hazelnuts, chocolate, roasted malts. Medium bodies with a creamy mouth feel. Wonderful winter sipper at 9.4% . Another winner from evil genius. Their trick or treat is phenomenal.
beer_name: Evil Genius Ill Have What Shes Having

review_blob: Jet black pour, but holding onto light at the bottom of the glass is a deep, ruby red. Creamy, milk-white head with nice lacing. Aromas of burnt coffee, roasted malt, chocolate, caramel and brown sugar. The taste is not as sweet as the nose; coffee, bitter chocolate, and nutty pine, with bitter finish, but has a nice slight sweet after taste as it warms. Creamy, medium-bodied porter with a pleasant mouthfeel. Overall, this is a nice American Porter

Pours a very dark brown, near black. Good deal of lacing.
Grapefruit lemon and grass, followed by roasted malts on the nose. Assertive floral hop flavor with citrus fruits, coffee and roasted malts. Smooth bitter finish. Nice black IPA

Enjoyed on tap at the Craft House in Thorndale PA. Appearance is jet black with a full three finger head which left nice lacings as it went down. Aromas of chocolate, roasted coffee beans, sugar with some notes of vanilla and caramel. Taste is like smoky malt up front with the chocolate coming through in a big way followed by coffee with a slight bitter sweet hop finish. Mouth feel is smooth with light carbonation. This beer is money as far as Im concerned; right up there with left hand brewing milk stout. I couldnt bring myself to order anything different because it was so good.

Cant believe I never reviewed this as many times as Ive had it. Pours a jet black with a 3 finger solid tan head to that dissipates quickly but leaves a nice lacing throughout. The aroma is like a Reeses Peanut Butter Cup; straight roasted peanuts and chocolate. The flavor is primarily coffee and chocolate with smoky peanut butter at the end. Mouthfeel has a smooth, medium body, light carbonation, with a nice bitter sweet malty finish. I really like it. Big Gruesome is a little better IMO

Deep amber appearance with a thin head that dissipates quickly, medium lacing. Nose is a mix of piney, grapefruity hops with brown sugar honeyed malts. Taste is sweet and citrus and pine up front, followed by notes of brown sugar, molasses and caramel. Mouth feel is smooth and resiney. Overall, this is superb, complex beer that gives you a sweetness of malt and brown sugar with the bite of an IPA

Thank to the bartender at Prontos in Thorndale, PA for recommending this winner. Dark brown pour with minimal head. Aromas of baked pumpkin pie, cinnamon and nutmeg. Taste is sweet pumpkin and dark chocolate with a smooth bitter sweet malty finish. Creamy full bodied mouth feel with medium carbonation. This beer is awesome. It is unbelievably smooth for 10% ABV. Hands down best Ive had in the the style. If you like imperial stouts give this a shot.

Enjoyed from a growler filled from the tap at Victory brewpub. 
Jet black pour with no head. 
As advertised, aromas of coffee precede an inviting blend of sweet bourbon, oak and a hint of alcohol. Tastes of coffee, dark chocolate, and vanilla. Thick mouth feel with little carbonation. Reminds me of Ale Smith Speedway Stout. Definitely a sipping brew at 14%

Appearance - Pours a dark brown, almost black with a creamy tan head that stands 3 fingers on a moderately gentle pour.

Aroma- Roasted Cocoa, Coffee and Peanuts.

Taste - Up front a cocoa and coffee flavor. The peanut butter starts to show itself towards the end of the swallow with a very bitter finish.

Mouthfeel - High carbonation, medium-thick body.

Overall - In my opinion this is not as good sweet baby Jesus or Big Gruesome which is the best Ive tasted in this style.

Bronze copper appearance with a half-finger off-white head; strong lacing. Aromas of nutmeg, cinnamon, pumkin, squash and sugary, syrupy sweetness with alcohol hints at the 9.5% ABV. The taste, rum, vanilla and spice and molasses with medium carbonation. Dry finish on the back end. A strong ale that is full-bodied and weighty, but drinkable

Enjoyed from a growler purchased from Victory. Murky dark amber appearance. Banana, plum, cloves, cherries, and spices on the nose. Taste has a well-balanced sweetness with a mixture of flavors mirroring those aromas. Smooth full bodied mouth feel with moderate carbonation. Excellent weizenbock. Give it a try if you like the style.
It looks, smells, and tastes just like root beer. Too sweet for me but I its tasty. Definitely worth a try if you like root beer.
beer_name: Small Town Not Your Fathers Root Beer (5.9%)

review_blob: 22oz bottle poured into my Movie Tavern tanker. Color is an amber orange with minimal head and lacing. It smells delicious; caramel, nutmeg, cinnamon and fresh pumpkin. The taste is primarily nutmeg, but the fresh pumpkin comes bursting through with slight cinnamon notes. Mouthfeel is rich, but smooth with medium carbonation. Very quaffable for an imperial ale, so beware of the 8.6% ABV

Aromas of coffee, roasted malts and chocolate with a consistent taste that follows. Coffee and chocolate are bold and powerful with a bitter, slightly boozy finish. Medium body with a light carbonation. Velvety smooth.

First tried at King of Prussia Beerfest Royal and for me, it was the hit of the show. Found a six pack at Wegmans a few days later. Aromas of chocolate and spice. Tastes of chocolate, toasty malts and pumpkin spices with a hint of roasted coffee. Mediem body with low carbonation. As far as Im concerned, Evil Genius nailed this one. Its absolutely delicious if you like this style.
beer_name: Evil Genius Trick or Treat Chocolate Pumpkin Porter

review_blob: Got it on tap at Victory taken home in a growler. Golden pour with a one finger white head. Plenty of lacing on the glass as it goes down. Strong romas of pine, with some melon and grape flavor. Spices come through as it warms. Refreshing light body. Very nice IPA

It starts off with the classic saison flavor, yeast, some lemon, and soft wheaty malts and then the spices kick in. There is a spicy hop bitterness and a flavor of thyme and whats that? Oregano. Overall it is a light tasting beer that heavily showcases its spicy flavor. It works out very nicely. Perfect pairing for pizza.
beer_name: Victory / Stone / Dogfish Head Saison du BUFF

review_blob: UPDATED: JAN 9, 2016

Pours black with a minimum tan head. Typical coffee and chocolate aroma. Tastes starts sweet and chocolate with a surprisingly bitter hop finish. Medium carbination with a creamy mouth feel. Alcohol content is well hidden. Good stuff.

Deep dark brown with a thick foamy tan head. Solid lacing. Roasted coffee, burnt grains, chocolate, vanilla, even some cherry, come through. Subtlety sweet fruit surprises you at first with a blast of cherry, then chocolate and brown sugar, follow by roasted malt and finished perfectly with a slightly hop flavor.Very light in body, moderate carbonation, great creamy finish.A very well balanced easy drinking porter.
Some fruity aromas especially pear. Astrong smell of Belgian bready malts, Herbal hops and a slight spiciness. Unique white IPA. Nice summer beverage.

Clear why this is Troegs most popular beer. (If you get a chance to visit their brewery in Hershey PA, do the guided tour). Big pine and citrus aroma. Delicious hoppy taste with a bitter malt finish. Light carbonation so it goes down smooth, which makes it dangerous because that 7.5 can creep up on you. Very good beer.
Very drinkable 8.3% double IPA. Nothing special, but I would drink it again

A: Lighter than expected chestnut with a big dose of floaties but a prodigious 3-4 finger light beige head with decent retention and peaks of lacing.

S: Major fruity aroma here with fig, plums, red grapes, currants, bananas, and orange marmalade all combining with some mild herbal hopping to create a huge malt blast. The entire aroma experience is accentuated by further fruity yeast esters with a mild, phenolic, clove character

T: The flavor also assaults with malt, first with dark fruits like red and purple grapes, figs, cherries, plums, and raisins, all dosed with a heavy dose of rum-infused honey. Hops provide some balancing herbal-based bitterness. Yeast esters play a big role with banana and some lightly sulfuric apricot and peach character as well. Bitterness is low -- this is a malt wallop all the way, and a good one too. Vinous without getting wondery -- a masterful beer all-around. The alcohol is tame and in the background.

M: Silky smooth with nowhere the 12% detectable anywhere. Sumptuous feel overall with moderate carbonation to keep it from feeling too thick and viscous.

O: This was indeed a good one to put away -- wow -- huge dark fruit character with drinkability.

Smells wonderful, pine, grapefruits, orange.. Dark blonde, copper appearance with a thin creamy head. Tastes is exquisite, nice malt backbone with a pine finish that lingers. One of the best IPAs Ive tasted.
This is a realing solid IPA. Has a big pine citrus aroma. Nice hoppy taste with flavors of grapefruit, orange peel and piney notes with a malt finish. Very tasty
Pours black with a minimal tan head. Aroma and tastes of coffee, chocolate, vanilla and booze as it warms. Full bodied silky mouth feel. Reminds me Brooklyn chocolate stout.
This is a really good beer. Dark appearance with a thin tan head. Plenty of lacings left on the glass. Tasste of chocolate and coffee. Light, yet flavorful. If you like Guinness, youll love this.
One of my favorite Victory beers. Complex spicy, wheat taste that goes down smooth. A must try if like this style.
Pinkish, red color. As the guy sitting at bar next to me commented, "this is a bitter beer." Salty cherry flavor. Not one of my favorites, but its not my style.
Golden appearance, taste of lemons. Plenty of hops, but still light and refreshing

This beer has a huge citrus, pine aroma. Strong hop flavor, but smooth and balanced. Had from a can while watching the NCAA basketball championship. Taste is excellent, cant really find fault with this beer. Highest rating
This is very good sweet stout. It is silky smooth, and has a great balanced finish.
Aroma and taste of chocolate and coffee. A little boozy for a 7%ABV Not bad. Definitely not my favorite of this style.

Pours jet black with a nominal head, aroma of coffee and booze. Taste is Coffee, chocolate, sweet, malt and booze as it warms. This beer for is amazing. Right up there with Brooklyn chocolate stout as one of my favorites of this style. Mouth feel is creamy and full. Nothing bad to day about this brew. A must try for anyone who likes this style.

Big grapefruit and lemongrass notes, fruity hops, and pine. Taste is huge on hops, the grapefruit gives way to pine and malts. Aftertaste of bitter pine. Hop lovers will enjoy. They say hop ranch is similar, but I think hop ranch is much better. Be careful, that 8.7% ABV will creep up on you.

Pours black with an aroma of chocolate & peanut butter (not one more prominent than the other); smells just like a Reeces cup. This us the best peanut butter stout that ive come across; better than sweet baby Jesus

Pours black with a three finger mocha head. Intense chocolate flavor with a hint of nutty bitterness that lingers. Hints of dark fruits; light smooth body. Once again Victory came through on the his one. My new favorite porter.

Pours a thick and black. Smells like a chocolate and caramel; very strong caramel, coffee and dark chocolate notes. long bitter finish; flavors stay resident in the mouth for quite some time. Not as sweet as many other chocolate stouts I have tasted, but very good.

Aroma of cherries, honey and spice. Appearence is red and festive. Taste is aweet with fruity notes. First sip is a mix of honey cherry sweet malty goodness. Theres a nice spiciness thats running through here too, perhaps some nutmeg. Very drinkable, as people who dont typically like beer fancied this brew.
beer_name: Tregs The Mad Elf Holiday Ale

review_blob: Phenomenal beer, an instant favorite. Gotta love the hints of citrus, so pleasing to the nostrils and palate. I had it last year just before they stopped brewing it. Too bad it is seasonal, I want this year-round. Bought a case today the day it was released. II do happen to like it better than dirt wolf
beer_name: Victory Hop Ranch Imperial India Pale Ale

review_blob: Tasted from a 12oz bottle. It poured an jet black with with a frothy brown head and lacing that was fairly thick and creamy. Rich aromas of malt, chocolate, and a hint of coffee. Smooth tasting, roasted malt and semi-sweet chocolate taste. Really cant taste the 10% alcohol. My favorite chocolate stout.
